tuv.seg: If you have been called as a witness in a trial your main duty as a witness is to tell the truth
Má tá tú glaoite go dtí a bheith ina fhinné i dtriail Is é do dhualgas príomh mar fhinné an fhírinne a insint
If a judge forms the opinion that you have lied under oath, you may be prosecuted for perjury
Má cheapann breitheamh go bhfuil bréaga insithe agat faoi mhionn, d'fhéadfadh sé/sí an dlí a chur ort as fianaise bhréige a thabhairt é
In this section, you will find information about what it means to be a witness in a court case
Sa rannóg seo gheobhaidh tú eolas maidir le bheith i d’fhinné i gcás cúirte
There is information on the different types of witness, who is competent to be a witness (i.e., who is capable of being a witness), and who can be compelled to be a witness

Breathnófar ar na cineálacha finnéithe éagsúla, cé atá inniúil ar bheith ina f(h)inné (i.e., cé atá ábalta ar bheith ina f(h)inné) agus cé na daoine gur féidir iallach a chur orthu a bheith ina bhfinnéithe
You will also find information about how you are called to be a witness, the procedure for witness service and theprocedures in place for witnesses under 18 years

Tá eolas ar fáil freisin maidir leis an chaoi a nglaotar ar dhuine le bheith ina f(h)inné, an modh oibre atá ag an tseirbhís fhinné agus na socruithe a bhaineann le finnéithe atá faoi ocht mbliana déag d'aois
It also covers when you may give evidence by video-link and what the rules are in relation to the evidence you can give
Breathnófar ar na hamanna inár féidir fianaise a thabhairt le nasc físe agus cé na rialacha a bhaineann leis an bhfianaise gur féidir leat a thabhairt
Information on going to court as a witness is also available in a Director of Public Prosecutions (DPP) booklet
Tá eolas ar fáil freisin maidir le dul chuig an gcúirt mar fhinné sna leabhrán an Stiúrthóra Ionchúiseamh Poiblí
For more detailed information you should seek legal advice
Ba chóir duit comhairle dlí a lorg chun faisnéis mionsonraithe a fháil
